    Description
    Abstractor<P extends Prec,Pr extends Proof>
    Common interface for the abstractor component.
    AbstractorResult
    Represents the result of the Abstractor component, that can be either safe or unsafe.
    ArgAbstractor<S extends State,A extends Action,P extends Prec>
    Common interface for the abstractor component.
    ArgCegarChecker
    Counterexample-Guided Abstraction Refinement (CEGAR) loop implementation, that uses an Abstractor to explore the abstract state space and a Refiner to check counterexamples and refine them if needed.
    ArgRefiner<S extends State,A extends Action,P extends Prec>
    Common interface for refiners.
    BasicArgAbstractor<S extends State,A extends Action,P extends Prec>
    Basic implementation for the abstractor, relying on an ArgBuilder.
    BasicArgAbstractor.Builder<S extends State,A extends Action,P extends Prec>
     
    CegarChecker<P extends Prec,Pr extends Proof,C extends Cex>
    Counterexample-Guided Abstraction Refinement (CEGAR) loop implementation, that uses an Abstractor to explore the abstract state space and a Refiner to check counterexamples and refine them if needed.
    CegarStatistics
    Represents statistics collected by the CegarChecker algorithm.
    Refiner<P extends Prec,Pr extends Proof,C extends Cex>
    Common interface for refiners.
    RefinerResult<P extends Prec,C extends Cex>
    Represents the result of the Refiner class that can be either spurious or unsafe.
    RefinerResult.Spurious<P extends Prec,C extends Cex>
    Represents the spurious result with a refined precision.
    RefinerResult.Unsafe<P extends Prec,C extends Cex>
    Represents the unsafe result with a feasible counterexample.
